captions.text: I saw a mom who would die for her son
a man who would kill for his wife
laid out in front of him, the bad path. I saw it.
and the path was a circle.
But then I realized, I am being way too dramatic for all of this.
I don't have to kill myself.
I'll just choose to never leave this farm.
Which will change the older me's past...

Then Sara can raise her son in
a positive environment.

which would mean Sid never becomes the
rainmaker...
which means he never started closing loops...

which means none of the stuff
that happened to me in the last few days
which means I'm still a murdering drug addict...
Ah well, time travel is not really that confusing.
You just have to think of it more like this this big ball of...

I don't know maybe you just shouldn't even
use time travel if all you're gonna do is perform...
Who would ever think that was a safe idea?

of it was open to parody...like really open. It's tricky to get your head 
around really, which is why time travel shouldn't be used for the sole 
purpose of execution, far too many variable for something that is 
essentially messing with the structure of the universe. But then if people 
thought like that, what fun would that be? ﻿

comments.text:
This movie is real bad, I agree with you, but It's an example of what 
happens when another timeline is open because of the actions that change in 
the first timeline, The future protagonist is one of many alternatives that 
can modify by the actions of the past protagonist in the past, Doctor Who 
teaches us that in time travel you have to be aware that a lot of things 
can't change because it'll alter the timeline and thus, create a new one 
with different creations , when a loop opens, it's possible to visualize 
another dimension to start another timeline in that dimension, loops work 
between dimensions.
Also, love to see the tenth Doctor, Doc Brown, Bill and Ted and the Matrix 
together, they should definetely make a movie, or maybe they already did in 
another dimension with different timeline﻿

comments.text:
Maybe I am just reading into this a little too much. The thing is earlier 
in the movie both Joes had met at a diner where old Joe explained to his 
younger self that every experience and new memory young Joe acquires alters 
the way he remembers his life. So when young Joe began falling for Sara and 
bonding with Sid, wouldn't that have rid his future self any desire to kill 
these two? I know future Joe is a split personality but I'm sure by now in 
this alternate timeline, his present day self would have made it a foregone 
decision to stay with Sara and Sid, thus removing the possibility of him 
meeting his future wife and resolving the paradox.﻿

comments.author: barbiquearea

comments.text:
The thing that the movie writers didn't get is the concept of "open" and 
"closed" loops. In an "open" loop occurrence there is no butterfly effect, 
anyone that travels and makes an open loop is pretty much slated to die or 
their actions will splinter into a new timeline rendering their purpose 
void. In a "closed" loop all outcomes are determined and no changes can be 
made because to attempt to change events is actually a set occurrence, 
pretty much whatever you do things will progress the way they will.

The entire premise of this movie... was stupid (imo). If you're going to 
write a screen play about time travel... you have to kind of understand how 
time travel works. The open and closed loop theory isn't even that accurate 
because most scientists theorize time travel can only be in the forward 
direction. However is one is going to assume travel works in both ways, it 
follows the close and open paradigms. ﻿
comments.author: ToxicHyena

comments.text:
+Kevin Cho One thing that could explain why we haven’t been visited by time 
travelers is this:

A phone is useless without a second phone, and under the assumption that 
time travel is possible, time machines may have a similar limitation: 
Basically, the idea is that you need to have a receptor at the time you’re 
traveling to, otherwise you can’t complete the connection. If this is the 
case, then time travel can only occur from the invention of the first time 
machine (receptor) and forward. With that, time travel forwards and 
backwards could be possible, but you could just never travel further back 
than the invention of the first receptor.

If I remember correctly, this is how time travel worked in the Austin 
Powers movies (at least Dr. Evil’s time machine): You traveled from one 
time gate to another (or the same gate in another time).

comments.text:
You're in the minority who believes that its dumb. It has received high 
critical acclaim from critics. The ending was an ending that made perfect 
sense. As long as he lived, the cycle would have continued. His death meant 
breaking his destructive loop. And the telekinesis in the movie certainly 
does have a place. If you pay attention half way through the film, its 
explained that in the future, a man known as The Rainmaker has somehow 
taken control of every gang by himself. Which is impossible. Ever since the 
Rainmaker took control he has been closing down everyones loops. The 
Rainmaker was able to accomplish this feat with his powerful telekinetic 
abilities. The fact that he is a powerful telekinetic makes him a huge 
threat.

comments.author: WiggleSpeedTurbo

comments.text:
+he11b1ade
Science does not refute time travel,in fact it suggests the opposite being 
possible. Science works with the notion of ''it is possible until proven 
otherwise'', science is all about exploring,discovering and re-exploring 
and re-discovering when new scientific ideas come about that can be 
re-applied to a previously dismissed thesis.
 In fact,there are scientists working on the development of a time machine 
for years.
comments.author: Valeri

comments.text:
+Silent Dawn Or we could learn science and realise time travel cannot be 
possible and never was possible to begin with.
comments.author: he11b1ade

comments.text:
+Priorities
watch the movie again, it is established in the film that there is 
definitely only 1 timeline. In the movie universe there are no alternate 
timelines,there is only 1 everchanging universal timeline. This was 
confirmed in the film. And also the movie broke its own internal logic. If 
he had killed himself it means the old self never arrived,which means the 
INITIATIVE to kill himself  never occurred, THUS he could not have killed 
himself and would still be alive. The movie broke its own rules all the 
time.
comments.author: Valeri

comments.text:
+barbiquearea The way i see it is that there is two timelines and the old 
guy being moved back in time moved to a different time line that WAS 
identical to his, was going to be, but he was inserted into it.
comments.author: Priorities

comments.text:
+Silent Dawn
they aint,at all. Looper had huge internal logic errors, it contradicted 
its own rules it set up in the film.Not only was it incorrect from a 
quantum physics point of how time travel actually does work(no grandpa 
paradox,look up multiple world thesis!),but it violated the rules it 
created for itself within the film. It's like me proving unicorns cant fly 
and then later in the film thye fly ,despite it having been proven they 
cant earlier in the film. Looper ,for this reason,is not a good time travel 
reference film.
comments.author: Valeri

comments.text: +PaRi Or We can all agree that time travel stories are complicated, right?
comments.author: Silent Dawn

comments.text:
+Silent Dawn
Earlier in the movie, there was this guy who tried to run away from people, 
and they just kidnapped his younger version, and cut off his limbs, part 
for part, while you could see the running man's limbs vanishes, part for 
part. This was in realtime. So taking this into account, it should be 
possible for JGL's character to remove a finger, and see it Bruce Willis's 
finger vanish at that moment.
